newsitem.title: MALTA: Malta Mid-Med Bank share prices up.
newsitem.headline: Malta Mid-Med Bank share prices up.

text.p: Mid-Med Bank gained seven cents in Wednesday's trading session on the Malta stock exchange, the last cum-div session before the announcement of annual results on Thursday.
Average share prices in Bank of Valletta lost eight cents however as they traded ex-div.

Market turnover in the once-weekly trading session saw business of just over Lm 463,000 ($1.3 million) from Lm 432,200 ($1.2 million) last week. Trading was spread over 90 deals, of which 36 were in equities and 54 in fixed income securities. the value of the index dropped by 2.6 percent to 1019.29.
Business in equities amounted to just over Lm 123,800 with 81,207 shares being traded.
Of these 2,320 were Bank of Valletta, transacted at an average 125 cents, down eight cents as buyers conceded their right to a dividend.
There were 19 deals in Med-Med Bank, with 70,200 shares being transacted for an average 156 cents per share, up seven cents.
In Lombard Bank Malta, 2,000 shares changed hands for an average 151 cents, unchanged.
In Middle Sea Insurance 5,822 shares sold for average 122.8 cents, up eight mils.
Trading in Farsons 8.5 percent preference shares 1996/99 (nominal value Lm1) saw 865 shares sold for an average 101 cents, up almost a cent.

In the government bond market, 20 issues were dealt in, turnover reaching Lm 339,100. Business was mainly in the 7.25 percent MGS 2006 (II) and the 7.5 percent MGS 2011, in which both had a block trade.
